definitions: ready to conform to the authority or will of others without resistance
willing to submit to the sexual desires and control of another person
examples: The submissive employee never questioned any management decision
His submissive nature made him an easy target for bullies
They explored submissive and dominant roles in their relationship
The submissive partner agreed to follow the established boundaries

definitions: placed in or belonging to a lower order or rank in hierarchy
treated as less important or having less priority than something else
examples: The subordinate officers reported directly to the general
She refused to accept a subordinate position in the company
These subordinate issues can be addressed after the main problem
The subordinate clauses modify the main verb in this sentence

definitions: having arranged to receive a publication or service regularly by paying in advance
having formally signed or agreed to support a belief or proposal
examples: All subscribed members receive exclusive content every month
The subscribed users can access premium features immediately
The subscribed parties must honor the terms of agreement
All subscribed witnesses confirmed the accuracy of the statement

definitions: written or printed below and to the side of another character or symbol
examples: The subscript numbers indicate the chemical formula of water
Use subscript text for footnote references in academic papers

definitions: coming after something in time; following in order or succession
examples: The subsequent investigation revealed several overlooked details
All subsequent meetings will be held online this month

definitions: prepared to obey others unquestioningly and behave in an overly submissive way
serving as a means to assist or achieve something else of greater importance
examples: His subservient manner irritated his more independent colleagues
The subservient attitude toward authority troubled many observers
All other goals remained subservient to profit maximization
Personal interests became subservient to the collective good

definitions: serving to assist or supplement something of primary importance
controlled by a holding or parent company through ownership of shares
examples: These subsidiary arguments support but don't prove the main thesis
The subsidiary objectives can be pursued after main goals
The subsidiary company operates independently but reports to headquarters
Their subsidiary firms handle distribution in foreign markets

definitions: having costs partially paid by government or organization to reduce prices
examples: The subsidised housing program helps low-income families find homes
Students can buy subsidised meals in the university cafeteria

definitions: having costs partially paid by government or organization to reduce prices
examples: The subsidized lunch program feeds thousands of children daily
Farmers receive subsidized loans to purchase new equipment

definitions: relating to or flying at speeds less than the speed of sound
examples: Most commercial aircraft operate at subsonic speeds for efficiency
The subsonic wind tunnel tests aircraft models at lower speeds

definitions: falling below the normal or acceptable standard of quality or performance
examples: The substandard construction materials caused the building to fail inspection
Workers complained about substandard safety equipment in the factory

definitions: of considerable importance, size, value, or worth in amount or degree
strongly built or made with solid construction and good materials
concerning the essential points or having real importance and significance
examples: The company made substantial profits during the fourth quarter
A substantial portion of the budget goes to education
The substantial oak table could support considerable weight
They lived in a substantial Victorian house with thick walls
The report contained substantial evidence of financial misconduct
We need substantial reform, not just cosmetic changes

definitions: having a firm basis in reality and therefore important or meaningful
having a separate and independent existence rather than being subordinate
examples: The committee made substantive changes to the proposed legislation
We need substantive discussions about policy, not empty rhetoric
The substantive position requires Senate confirmation unlike acting roles
She holds a substantive rank in the military hierarchy

definitions: acting or serving in place of someone or something else temporarily
examples: The substitute teacher managed the class effectively all week
They used substitute ingredients when supplies ran low

definitions: existing, lying, or operating below the surface of something
examples: Subsurface water flows through underground rock formations naturally
The subsurface damage wasn't visible during the initial inspection

definitions: existing, occurring, or done under the earth's surface or underground
hidden or operating in secret beneath normal awareness or observation
examples: The subterranean cave system extends for miles beneath the mountain
Subterranean rivers carved these limestone passages over millennia
The subterranean political movement operated outside official channels
She sensed subterranean tensions during the seemingly friendly meeting

definitions: so delicate or refined as to be difficult to analyze or describe
making use of clever and indirect methods to achieve something
capable of making fine distinctions through acute mental discernment
examples: The wine had subtle notes of vanilla and oak
Her subtle perfume didn't overpower the room
The subtle changes in his behavior worried his family
There were subtle differences between the two proposals
His subtle hints about needing help went unnoticed
She used subtle persuasion rather than direct confrontation

definitions: relating to or involving the removal or subtraction of material or elements
examples: Subtractive manufacturing removes material to create the final shape
The subtractive color model combines pigments that absorb light

definitions: relating to regions adjacent to or bordering tropical areas with warm climate
examples: The subtropical climate supports diverse plant and animal species
Many subtropical fruits grow well in southern coastal regions

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the outlying residential areas of a city
examples: The suburban lifestyle appeals to families seeking more space
Suburban schools often have better funding than urban ones

definitions: seeking or intended to undermine established system or institution
challenging conventional thinking or artistic expression in provocative ways
examples: The government banned subversive political organizations from meeting
Subversive literature was confiscated during the authoritarian regime
Her subversive art challenged traditional gender roles effectively
The comedian's subversive humor mocked social conventions brilliantly

definitions: coming after or following something in time or order
examples: Each succeeding generation built upon previous achievements
The succeeding chapters explain the theory in greater detail

definitions: accomplishing an aim or purpose with the desired outcome
having achieved popularity, profit, or distinction in one's field
examples: The successful surgery restored full mobility to her knee
Their successful campaign resulted in significant policy changes
She became a successful entrepreneur before turning thirty
The successful author published twenty bestselling novels

definitions: following one another or following others in uninterrupted sequence
examples: The team won three successive championships in remarkable fashion
Successive waves of immigrants shaped the nation's culture

definitions: briefly and clearly expressed using few words without unnecessary detail
examples: Her succinct summary captured all the essential points perfectly
The manager preferred succinct reports over lengthy documents

definitions: tender, juicy, and tasty, especially describing well-prepared meat or fruit
having thick, fleshy tissues adapted to store water in arid climates
examples: The succulent roast beef melted in everyone's mouth
These succulent peaches are perfect for the summer pie
Succulent plants require minimal watering and bright sunlight
Her succulent garden thrived in the dry climate

definitions: undergoing or experiencing pain, distress, or hardship
examples: The suffering patients waited hours for emergency treatment
Suffering communities need immediate humanitarian aid and support

definitions: enough to meet the needs of a situation or proposed end
examples: We have sufficient evidence to proceed with the prosecution
The salary wasn't sufficient to cover their living expenses

definitions: causing difficulty in breathing or making it hard to breathe normally
overwhelming and oppressive to the point of causing extreme discomfort
examples: The suffocating smoke forced everyone to evacuate immediately
She loosened the suffocating collar around her neck
His suffocating attention made her feel trapped and anxious
The suffocating heat made working outdoors nearly impossible

definitions: containing a lot of sugar or tasting very sweet
excessively sweet or sentimental in tone, manner, or expression
examples: The sugary drinks contribute to childhood obesity rates
Children love sugary cereals despite their poor nutrition
Her sugary voice couldn't hide her true intentions
The movie's sugary ending disappointed critics seeking realism

definitions: tending to suggest something indirectly or serving as indication
making someone think of sex or sexual matters through implication
examples: The symptoms were suggestive of viral infection, not bacterial
Her behavior was suggestive of someone hiding important information
The comedian's suggestive jokes made some audience members uncomfortable
She wore a suggestive outfit to the nightclub party

definitions: having or showing a desire to kill oneself or relating to suicide
likely to have disastrously damaging consequences that amount to self-destruction
examples: The suicidal patient needs immediate psychiatric intervention and support
Suicidal thoughts require professional help without delay
That suicidal business strategy will bankrupt the company
Making that jump would be absolutely suicidal

definitions: right or appropriate for a particular person, purpose, or situation
examples: This venue is suitable for weddings and corporate events
The movie isn't suitable for young children

definitions: right or appropriate for someone or something's particular qualities
dressed in a suit of clothes, especially formal business attire
examples: They are perfectly suited for each other as partners
This job is suited to someone with your skills
The suited executives filled the boardroom for the meeting
A suited gentleman approached the reception desk

definitions: of, relating to, or containing sulfur, especially sulfuric acid
examples: Sulfuric acid is widely used in industrial chemical processes
The sulfuric compounds gave off a strong unpleasant odor

definitions: bad-tempered and sulky, showing irritation through silent resentment or moroseness
examples: The teenager gave a sullen response to parental questions
His sullen expression revealed his deep disappointment

definitions: of, relating to, or containing sulphur, especially sulphuric acid
examples: Sulphuric acid must be handled with extreme protective equipment
The sulphuric fumes corroded the metal storage containers

definitions: hot and humid weather that is uncomfortably oppressive
attractive in a way that suggests passionate sexual desire
examples: The sultry summer afternoon made everyone seek air conditioning
Sultry weather continued throughout the tropical vacation
Her sultry voice captivated everyone in the jazz club
The actress gave a sultry performance in the film

definitions: giving only the main points briefly without unnecessary detail
done immediately without the normal legal procedures or formalities
examples: The summary report highlighted key findings without elaboration
She provided a summary overview of the project
The dictator ordered summary executions of political opponents
Summary dismissal followed the discovery of theft

definitions: extremely expensive, elaborate, and impressive, suggesting great expense and luxury
examples: The sumptuous banquet featured dishes from world-renowned chefs
They stayed in a sumptuous hotel overlooking the Mediterranean

definitions: of various kinds forming a collection of different types
examples: The garage sale offered sundry household items and tools
Sundry expenses added up to a significant amount

definitions: having gone below the surface of water or another liquid
having been invested and unable to be recovered if abandoned
examples: The sunk ship became an artificial reef for marine life
Sunk posts marked the property boundary underwater
Don't consider sunk costs when making future business decisions
The sunk investment couldn't influence their strategic planning

definitions: having sunk or been submerged below the normal or surrounding level
hollow and deeper than the surrounding area, especially describing facial features
examples: The sunken garden provided a peaceful retreat from noise
Archaeologists discovered a sunken city off the coast
His sunken eyes revealed weeks of illness and exhaustion
The sunken cheeks made her face appear gaunt

definitions: lit up by light from the sun creating bright illumination
examples: The sunlit meadow sparkled with morning dew
Children played in the sunlit courtyard all afternoon

definitions: bright with sunlight or receiving much sunshine during the day
cheerful and optimistic in mood, manner, or disposition
examples: The sunny weather brought everyone outside to enjoy nature
We spent a sunny afternoon at the beach
Her sunny personality brightened everyone's day at work
Despite challenges, he maintained a sunny outlook

definitions: happening or relating to the time when the sun appears above the horizon
examples: The sunrise ceremony begins exactly when light appears
Sunrise yoga classes attract early-morning fitness enthusiasts

definitions: happening or relating to the time when the sun disappears below the horizon
relating to the final or declining phase of something's existence
examples: The sunset cruise offers spectacular views of the coastline
Sunset colors painted the sky in brilliant oranges
The sunset years of his career were surprisingly productive
Sunset provisions in the law expire after five years

definitions: of excellent quality or extremely good in informal usage
above, over, or beyond in degree, quality, or extent
examples: The kids had a super time at the amusement park
That's a super idea for solving our problem
The super heavyweight division includes the largest boxers
Super conductors operate at extremely low temperatures

definitions: excellent, impressive, or magnificent in quality or appearance
examples: The chef prepared a superb meal for the anniversary
Her superb performance earned a standing ovation

definitions: fitted with a supercharger to increase engine power through forced air intake
filled with intense energy, emotion, or excitement beyond normal levels
examples: The supercharged engine delivered incredible acceleration and power
His supercharged sports car reached sixty in three seconds
The supercharged atmosphere at the concert was electric
Coffee left her feeling supercharged for the presentation
